subtitle
column12: colorSlug

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to safely managed drinking water
column3: Safely managed drinking water is water from an improved water source which is located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to basic drinking water
column3: Basic drinking water is water from an improved source, where the collection time is not more than 30 minutes for a roundtrip.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population that relies on limited drinking water facilities
column3: Limited drinking water is water from an improved source, where the collection time exceeds 30 minutes for a roundtrip.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population that relies on unimproved drinking water facilities
column3: An unimproved drinking water source is water from an unprotected dug well or unprotected spring.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with no access to drinking water
column3: Having no access to drinking water means people rely on surface water: directly from a river, dam, lake, pond, stream, canal or irrigation canal.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to improved drinking water
column3: Improved drinking water sources are those that have the potential to deliver safe water. They include piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, and packaged or delivered water.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to safely managed sanitation
column3: Safely managed sanitation is improved facilities which are not shared with other households and where excreta are safely disposed in situ or transported and treated off-site.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to basic sanitation
column3: Basic sanitation is improved facilities which are not shared with other households.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to limited sanitation facilities
column3: Limited sanitation is improved facilities shared between two or more households.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to unimproved sanitation facilities
column3: Unimproved sanitation is the use of pit latrines without a slab or platform, hanging latrines or bucket latrines.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population practicing open defecation
column3: Open defecation is the disposal of human faeces in fields, forests, bushes, open bodies of water, beaches and other open spaces or with solid waste.

Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Dat: Share of the population with access to improved sanitation
column3: Improved sanitation facilities are designed to hygienically separate excreta from human contact. They include flush to piped sewer system, septic tanks or pit latrines; ventilated improved pit latrines, composting toilets or pit latrines with slabs.
